2701}
2702
2703void npc::move_away_from( const std::vector<sphere> &spheres, bool no_bashing )
2704{
2705 if( spheres.empty() ) {
2706 return;
2707 }
2708
2709 tripoint minp( pos() );
2710 tripoint maxp( pos() );
2711
2712 for( const auto &elem : spheres ) {
2713 minp.x = std::min( minp.x, elem.center.x - elem.radius );
2714 minp.y = std::min( minp.y, elem.center.y - elem.radius );
2715 maxp.x = std::max( maxp.x, elem.center.x + elem.radius );
2716 maxp.y = std::max( maxp.y, elem.center.y + elem.radius );
2717 }
2718
2719 const tripoint_range<tripoint> range( minp, maxp );
2720
2721 std::vector<tripoint> escape_points;
2722
2723 map &here = get_map();
2724 std::copy_if( range.begin(), range.end(), std::back_inserter( escape_points ),
2725 [&here]( const tripoint & elem ) {
2726 return here.passable( elem );
2727 } );
2728
2729 cata::sort_by_rating( escape_points.begin(), escape_points.end(), [&]( const tripoint & elem ) {
2730 const int danger = std::accumulate( spheres.begin(), spheres.end(), 0,
2731 [&]( const int sum, const sphere & s ) {
2732 return sum + std::max( s.radius - rl_dist( elem, s.center ), 0 );
2733 } );
2734
2735 const int distance = rl_dist( pos(), elem );
2736 const int move_cost = here.move_cost( elem );
2737
2738 return std::make_tuple( danger, distance, move_cost );
2739 } );
2740
2741 for( const auto &elem : escape_points ) {
2742 update_path( elem, no_bashing );
2743
2744 if( elem == pos() || !path.empty() ) {
2745 break;
2746 }
2747 }
2748
2749 if( !path.empty() ) {
2750 move_to_next();
2751 } else {
2752 move_pause();
2753 }
2754}
2755
2756void npc::see_item_say_smth( const itype_id &object, const std::string &smth )
2757{
2758 map &here = get_map();
2759 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), 6 ) ) {
2760 if( here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) && sees( p ) ) {
2761 for( const item &it : here.i_at( p ) ) {
2762 if( one_in( 100 ) && ( it.typeId() == object ) ) {
2763 say( smth );
2764 }
2765 }
2766 }
2767 }
2768}
2769
2770void npc::find_item()
2771{
2772 if( is_hallucination() ) {
2773 see_item_say_smth( itype_thorazine, "<no_to_thorazine>" );
2774 see_item_say_smth( itype_lsd, "<yes_to_lsd>" );
2775 return;
2776 }
2777
2778 if( is_player_ally() && !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_pick_up ) ) {
2779 // Grabbing stuff not allowed by our "owner"
2780 return;
2781 }
2782
2783 fetching_item = false;
2784 int best_value = minimum_item_value();
2785 // Not perfect, but has to mirror pickup code
2786 units::volume volume_allowed = volume_capacity() - volume_carried();
2787 units::mass weight_allowed = weight_capacity() - weight_carried();
2788 // For some reason range limiting by vision doesn't work properly
2789 const int range = 6;
2790 //int range = sight_range( g->light_level( posz() ) );
2791 //range = std::max( 1, std::min( 12, range ) );
2792
2793 static const zone_type_id zone_type_no_npc_pickup( "NO_NPC_PICKUP" );
2794
2795 const item *wanted = nullptr;
2796
2797 const bool whitelisting = has_item_whitelist();
2798
2799 if( volume_allowed <= 0_ml || weight_allowed <= 0_gram ) {
2800 return;
2801 }
2802
2803 const auto consider_item =
2804 [&wanted, &best_value, whitelisting, volume_allowed, weight_allowed, this]
2805 ( const item & it, const tripoint & p ) {
2806 if( it.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
2807 // Don't even consider liquids.
2808 return;
2809 }
2810 std::vector<npc *> followers;
2811 for( auto &elem : g->get_follower_list() ) {
2812 shared_ptr_fast<npc> npc_to_get = overmap_buffer.find_npc( elem );
2813 if( !npc_to_get ) {
2814 continue;
2815 }
2816 npc *npc_to_add = npc_to_get.get();
2817 followers.push_back( npc_to_add );
2818 }
2819 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
2820 for( auto &elem : followers ) {
2821 if( !it.is_owned_by( *this, true ) && ( player_character.sees( this->pos() ) ||
2822 player_character.sees( wanted_item_pos ) ||
2823 elem->sees( this->pos() ) || elem->sees( wanted_item_pos ) ) ) {
2824 return;
2825 }
2826 }
2827 if( whitelisting && !item_whitelisted( it ) ) {
2828 return;
2829 }
2830
2831 // When using a whitelist, skip the value check
2832 // TODO: Whitelist hierarchy?
2833 int itval = whitelisting ? 1000 : value( it );
2834
2835 if( itval > best_value &&
2836 ( it.volume() <= volume_allowed && it.weight() <= weight_allowed ) ) {
2837 wanted_item_pos = p;
2838 wanted = &( it );
2839 best_value = itval;
2840 }
2841 };
2842
2843 map &here = get_map();
2844 // Harvest item doesn't exist, so we'll be checking by its name
2845 std::string wanted_name;
2846 const auto consider_terrain =
2847 [ this, whitelisting, volume_allowed, &wanted, &wanted_name, &here ]( const tripoint & p ) {
2848 // We only want to pick plants when there are no items to pick
2849 if( !whitelisting || wanted != nullptr || !wanted_name.empty() || volume_allowed < 250_ml ) {
2850 return;
2851 }
2852
2853 const auto &harvest = here.get_harvest_names( p );
2854 for( const auto &entry : harvest ) {
2855 if( item_name_whitelisted( entry ) ) {
2856 wanted_name = entry;
2857 wanted_item_pos = p;
2858 break;
2859 }
2860 }
2861 };
2862
2863 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), range ) ) {
2864 // TODO: Make this sight check not overdraw nearby tiles
2865 // TODO: Optimize that zone check
2866 if( is_player_ally() && g->check_zone( zone_type_no_npc_pickup, p ) ) {
2867 continue;
2868 }
2869
2870 const tripoint abs_p = global_square_location() - pos() + p;
2871 const int prev_num_items = ai_cache.searched_tiles.get( abs_p, -1 );
2872 // Prefetch the number of items present so we can bail out if we already checked here.
2873 const map_stack m_stack = here.i_at( p );
2874 int num_items = m_stack.size();
2875 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( p );
2876 if( vp ) {
2877 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargo = vp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_CARGO, true );
2878 if( cargo ) {
2879 vehicle_stack v_stack = cargo->vehicle().get_items( cargo->part_index() );
2880 num_items += v_stack.size();
2881 }
2882 }
2883 if( prev_num_items == num_items ) {
2884 continue;
2885 }
2886 auto cache_tile = [this, &abs_p, num_items, &wanted]() {
2887 if( wanted == nullptr ) {
2888 ai_cache.searched_tiles.insert( 1000, abs_p, num_items );
2889 }
2890 };
2891 bool can_see = false;
2892 if( here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) && sees( p ) ) {
2893 can_see = true;
2894 for( const item &it : m_stack ) {
2895 consider_item( it, p );
2896 }
2897 }
2898
2899 // Not cached because it gets checked once and isn't expected to change.
2900 if( can_see || sees( p ) ) {
2901 can_see = true;
2902 consider_terrain( p );
2903 }
2904
2905 if( !vp || vp->vehicle().is_moving() || !( can_see || sees( p ) ) ) {
2906 cache_tile();
2907 continue;
2908 }
2909 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargo = vp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_CARGO, true );
2910 static const std::string locked_string( "LOCKED" );
2911 // TODO: Let player know what parts are safe from NPC thieves
2912 if( !cargo || cargo->has_feature( locked_string ) ) {
2913 cache_tile();
2914 continue;
2915 }
2916
2917 static const std::string cargo_locking_string( "CARGO_LOCKING" );
2918 if( vp.part_with_feature( cargo_locking_string, true ) ) {
2919 cache_tile();
2920 continue;
2921 }
2922
2923 for( const item &it : cargo->vehicle().get_items( cargo->part_index() ) ) {
2924 consider_item( it, p );
2925 }
2926 cache_tile();
2927 }
2928
2929 if( wanted != nullptr ) {
2930 wanted_name = wanted->tname();
2931 }
2932
2933 if( wanted_name.empty() ) {
2934 return;
2935 }
2936
2937 fetching_item = true;
2938
2939 // TODO: Move that check above, make it multi-target pathing and use it
2940 // to limit tiles available for choice of items
2941 const int dist_to_item = rl_dist( wanted_item_pos, pos() );
2942 if( const cata::optional<tripoint> dest = nearest_passable( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) ) {
2943 update_path( *dest );
2944 }
2945
2946 if( path.empty() && dist_to_item > 1 ) {
2947 // Item not reachable, let's just totally give up for now
2948 fetching_item = false;
2949 }
2950
2951 if( fetching_item && rl_dist( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) > 1 && is_walking_with() ) {
2952 say( _( "Hold on, I want to pick up that %s." ), wanted_name );
2953 }
2954}
2955
2956void npc::pick_up_item()
2957{
2958 if( is_hallucination() ) {
2959 return;
2960 }
2961
2962 if( !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_pick_up ) && is_player_ally() ) {
2963 add_msg( m_debug, "%s::pick_up_item(); Canceling on player's request", name );
2964 fetching_item = false;
2965 moves -= 1;
2966 return;
2967 }
2968
2969 map &here = get_map();
2970 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> vp = here.veh_at( wanted_item_pos ).part_with_feature(
2971 VPFLAG_CARGO, false );
2972 const bool has_cargo = vp && !vp->has_feature( "LOCKED" );
2973
2974 if( ( !here.has_items( wanted_item_pos ) && !has_cargo &&
2975 !here.is_harvestable( wanted_item_pos ) && sees( wanted_item_pos ) ) ||
2976 ( is_player_ally() && g->check_zone( zone_type_id( "NO_NPC_PICKUP" ), wanted_item_pos ) ) ) {
2977 // Items we wanted no longer exist and we can see it
2978 // Or player who is leading us doesn't want us to pick it up
2979 fetching_item = false;
2980 move_pause();
2981 add_msg( m_debug, "Canceling pickup - no items or new zone" );
2982 return;
2983 }
2984
2985 add_msg( m_debug, "%s::pick_up_item(); [%d, %d, %d] => [%d, %d, %d]", name,
2986 posx(), posy(), posz(), wanted_item_pos.x, wanted_item_pos.y, wanted_item_pos.z );
2987 if( const cata::optional<tripoint> dest = nearest_passable( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) ) {
2988 update_path( *dest );
2989 }
2990
2991 const int dist_to_pickup = rl_dist( pos(), wanted_item_pos );
2992 if( dist_to_pickup > 1 && !path.empty() ) {
2993 add_msg( m_debug, "Moving; [%d, %d, %d] => [%d, %d, %d]",
2994 posx(), posy(), posz(), path[0].x, path[0].y, path[0].z );
2995
2996 move_to_next();
2997 return;
2998 } else if( dist_to_pickup > 1 && path.empty() ) {
2999 add_msg( m_debug, "Can't find path" );
3000 // This can happen, always do something
3001 fetching_item = false;
3002 move_pause();
3003 return;
3004 }
3005
3006 // We're adjacent to the item; grab it!
3007
3008 auto picked_up = pick_up_item_map( wanted_item_pos );
3009 if( picked_up.empty() && has_cargo ) {
3010 picked_up = pick_up_item_vehicle( vp->vehicle(), vp->part_index() );
3011 }
3012
3013 if( picked_up.empty() ) {
3014 // Last chance: plant harvest
3015 if( here.is_harvestable( wanted_item_pos ) ) {
3016 here.examine( *this, wanted_item_pos );
3017 // Note: we didn't actually pick up anything, just spawned items
3018 // but we want the item picker to find new items
3019 fetching_item = false;
3020 return;
3021 }
3022 }
3023 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3024 // Describe the pickup to the player
3025 bool u_see = player_character.sees( *this ) || player_character.sees( wanted_item_pos );
3026 if( u_see ) {
3027 if( picked_up.size() == 1 ) {
3028 add_msg( _( "%1$s picks up a %2$s." ), name, picked_up.front().tname() );
3029 } else if( picked_up.size() == 2 ) {
3030 add_msg( _( "%1$s picks up a %2$s and a %3$s." ), name, picked_up.front().tname(),
3031 picked_up.back().tname() );
3032 } else if( picked_up.size() > 2 ) {
3033 add_msg( _( "%s picks up several items." ), name );
3034 } else {
3035 add_msg( _( "%s looks around nervously, as if searching for something." ), name );
3036 }
3037 }
3038
3039 for( auto &it : picked_up ) {
3040 int itval = value( it );
3041 if( itval < worst_item_value ) {
3042 worst_item_value = itval;
3043 }
3044 i_add( it );
3045 }
3046
3047 moves -= 100;
3048 fetching_item = false;
3049 has_new_items = true;
3050}
3051
3052template <typename T>
3053std::list<item> npc_pickup_from_stack( npc &who, T &items )
3054{
3055 const bool whitelisting = who.has_item_whitelist();
3056 auto volume_allowed = who.volume_capacity() - who.volume_carried();
3057 auto weight_allowed = who.weight_capacity() - who.weight_carried();
3058 auto min_value = whitelisting ? 0 : who.minimum_item_value();
3059 std::list<item> picked_up;
3060
3061 for( auto iter = items.begin(); iter != items.end(); ) {
3062 const item &it = *iter;
3063 if( it.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
3064 iter++;
3065 continue;
3066 }
3067
3068 if( whitelisting && !who.item_whitelisted( it ) ) {
3069 iter++;
3070 continue;
3071 }
3072
3073 auto volume = it.volume();
3074 if( volume > volume_allowed ) {
3075 iter++;
3076 continue;
3077 }
3078
3079 auto weight = it.weight();
3080 if( weight > weight_allowed ) {
3081 iter++;
3082 continue;
3083 }
3084
3085 int itval = whitelisting ? 1000 : who.value( it );
3086 if( itval < min_value ) {
3087 iter++;
3088 continue;
3089 }
3090
3091 volume_allowed -= volume;
3092 weight_allowed -= weight;
3093 picked_up.push_back( it );
3094 iter = items.erase( iter );
3095 }
3096
3097 return picked_up;
3098}
3099
3100std::list<item> npc::pick_up_item_map( const tripoint &where )
3101{
3102 map_stack stack = get_map().i_at( where );
3103 return npc_pickup_from_stack( *this, stack );
3104}
3105
3106std::list<item> npc::pick_up_item_vehicle( vehicle &veh, int part_index )
3107{
3108 auto stack = veh.get_items( part_index );
3109 return npc_pickup_from_stack( *this, stack );
3110}

3112// Used in npc::drop_items()
3113struct ratio_index {
3114 double ratio;
3115 int index;
3116 ratio_index( double R, int I ) : ratio( R ), index( I ) {}
3117};
3118
3119/* As of October 2019, this is buggy, do not use!! */
3120void npc::drop_items( units::mass drop_weight, units::volume drop_volume, int min_val )
3121{
3122 /* Remove this when someone debugs it back to functionality */
3123 return;
3124
3125 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is dropping items-%3.2f kg, %3.2f L (%d items, wgt %3.2f/%3.2f kg, "
3126 "vol %3.2f/%3.2f L)",
3127 name, units::to_kilogram( drop_weight ), units::to_liter( drop_volume ), inv.size(),
3128 units::to_kilogram( weight_carried() ), units::to_kilogram( weight_capacity() ),
3129 units::to_liter( volume_carried() ), units::to_liter( volume_capacity() ) );
3130
3131 units::mass weight_dropped = units::from_gram( 0 );
3132 units::volume volume_dropped = units::from_liter( 0 );
3133 std::vector<ratio_index> rWgt, rVol; // Weight/Volume to value ratios
3134
3135 // First fill our ratio vectors, so we know which things to drop first
3136 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3137 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
3138 item &it = slice[i]->front();
3139 double wgt_ratio = 0.0;
3140 double vol_ratio = 0.0;
3141 if( value( it ) == 0 || value( it ) <= min_val ) {
3142 wgt_ratio = 99999;
3143 vol_ratio = 99999;
3144 } else {
3145 wgt_ratio = units::to_gram<double>( it.weight() ) / value( it );
3146 vol_ratio = units::to_liter( it.volume() / value( it ) );
3147 }
3148 bool added_wgt = false;
3149 bool added_vol = false;
3150 for( size_t j = 0; j < rWgt.size() && !added_wgt; j++ ) {
3151 if( wgt_ratio > rWgt[j].ratio ) {
3152 added_wgt = true;
3153 rWgt.insert( rWgt.begin() + j, ratio_index( wgt_ratio, i ) );
3154 }
3155 }
3156 if( !added_wgt ) {
3157 rWgt.push_back( ratio_index( wgt_ratio, i ) );
3158 }
3159 for( size_t j = 0; j < rVol.size() && !added_vol; j++ ) {
3160 if( vol_ratio > rVol[j].ratio ) {
3161 added_vol = true;
3162 rVol.insert( rVol.begin() + j, ratio_index( vol_ratio, i ) );
3163 }
3164 }
3165 if( !added_vol ) {
3166 rVol.push_back( ratio_index( vol_ratio, i ) );
3167 }
3168 }
3169
3170 map &here = get_map();
3171 std::string item_name; // For description below
3172 int num_items_dropped = 0; // For description below
3173 // Now, drop items, starting from the top of each list
3174 while( weight_dropped < drop_weight || volume_dropped < drop_volume ) {
3175 // weight and volume may be passed as 0 or a negative value, to indicate that
3176 // decreasing that variable is not important.
3177 int dWeight = units::to_gram<int>( drop_weight ) <= 0 ? -1 :
3178 units::to_gram<int>( drop_weight - weight_dropped ) / 250;
3179 int dVolume = units::to_milliliter<int>( drop_volume ) <= 0 ? -1 :
3180 units::to_milliliter<int>( drop_volume - volume_dropped ) / 250;
3181 int index;
3182 // Which is more important, weight or volume?
3183 if( dWeight > dVolume ) {
3184 index = rWgt[0].index;
3185 rWgt.erase( rWgt.begin() );
3186 // Fix the rest of those indices.
3187 for( auto &elem : rWgt ) {
3188 if( elem.index > index ) {
3189 elem.index--;
3190 }
3191 }
3192 } else {
3193 index = rVol[0].index;
3194 rVol.erase( rVol.begin() );
3195 // Fix the rest of those indices.
3196 for( size_t i = 0; i < rVol.size(); i++ ) {
3197 if( i > rVol.size() ) {
3198 debugmsg( "npc::drop_items() - looping through rVol - Size is %d, i is %d",
3199 rVol.size(), i );
3200 }
3201 if( rVol[i].index > index ) {
3202 rVol[i].index--;
3203 }
3204 }
3205 }
3206 weight_dropped += slice[index]->front().weight();
3207 volume_dropped += slice[index]->front().volume();
3208 item dropped = i_rem( index );
3209 num_items_dropped++;
3210 if( num_items_dropped == 1 ) {
3211 item_name += dropped.tname();
3212 } else if( num_items_dropped == 2 ) {
3213 item_name += _( " and " ) + dropped.tname();
3214 }
3215 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations can't drop real items
3216 here.add_item_or_charges( pos(), dropped );
3217 }
3218 }
3219 // Finally, describe the action if u can see it
3220 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3221 if( num_items_dropped >= 3 ) {
3222 add_msg( vgettext( "%s drops %d item.", "%s drops %d items.", num_items_dropped ), name,
3223 num_items_dropped );
3224 } else {
3225 add_msg( _( "%1$s drops a %2$s." ), name, item_name );
3226 }
3227 }
3228 update_worst_item_value();
3229}
3230
3231bool npc::find_corpse_to_pulp()
3232{
3233 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3234 if( ( is_player_ally() && ( !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_pulp ) ||
3235 player_character.in_vehicle ) ) ||
3236 is_hallucination() ) {
3237 return false;
3238 }
3239
3240 map &here = get_map();
3241 // Pathing with overdraw can get expensive, limit it
3242 int path_counter = 4;
3243 const auto check_tile = [this, &path_counter, &here]( const tripoint & p ) -> const item * {
3244 if( !here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) || !sees( p ) )
3245 {
3246 return nullptr;
3247 }
3248
3249 const map_stack items = here.i_at( p );
3250 const item *found = nullptr;
3251 for( const item &it : items )
3252 {
3253 // Pulp only stuff that revives, but don't pulp acid stuff
3254 // That is, if you aren't protected from this stuff!
3255 if( it.can_revive() ) {
3256 // If the first encountered corpse bleeds something dangerous then
3257 // it is not safe to bash.
3258 if( is_dangerous_field( field_entry( it.get_mtype()->bloodType(), 1, 0_turns ) ) ) {
3259 return nullptr;
3260 }
3261
3262 found = &it;
3263 break;
3264 }
3265 }
3266
3267 if( found != nullptr )
3268 {
3269 path_counter--;
3270 // Only return corpses we can path to
3271 return update_path( p, false, false ) ? found : nullptr;
3272 }
3273
3274 return nullptr;
3275 };
3276
3277 const int range = 6;
3278
3279 const item *corpse = nullptr;
3280 if( pulp_location && square_dist( pos(), *pulp_location ) <= range ) {
3281 corpse = check_tile( *pulp_location );
3282 }
3283
3284 // Find the old target to avoid spamming
3285 const item *old_target = corpse;
3286
3287 if( corpse == nullptr ) {
3288 // If we're following the player, don't wander off to pulp corpses
3289 const tripoint &around = is_walking_with() ? player_character.pos() : pos();
3290 for( const item_location &location : here.get_active_items_in_radius( around, range,
3291 special_item_type::corpse ) ) {
3292 corpse = check_tile( location.position() );
3293
3294 if( corpse != nullptr ) {
3295 pulp_location.emplace( location.position() );
3296 break;
3297 }
3298
3299 if( path_counter <= 0 ) {
3300 break;
3301 }
3302 }
3303 }
3304
3305 if( corpse != nullptr && corpse != old_target && is_walking_with() ) {
3306 say( _( "Hold on, I want to pulp that %s." ), corpse->tname() );
3307 }
3308
3309 return corpse != nullptr;
3310}
3311
3312bool npc::do_pulp()
3313{
3314 if( !pulp_location ) {
3315 return false;
3316 }
3317
3318 if( rl_dist( *pulp_location, pos() ) > 1 || pulp_location->z != posz() ) {
3319 return false;
3320 }
3321 // TODO: Don't recreate the activity every time
3322 int old_moves = moves;
3323 assign_activity( ACT_PULP, calendar::INDEFINITELY_LONG, 0 );
3324 activity.placement = get_map().getabs( *pulp_location );
3325 activity.do_turn( *this );
3326 return moves != old_moves;
3327}
3328
3329bool npc::do_player_activity()
3330{
3331 int old_moves = moves;
3332 if( moves > 200 && activity && ( activity.is_multi_type() ||
3333 activity.id() == activity_id( "ACT_TIDY_UP" ) ) ) {
3334 // a huge backlog of a multi-activity type can forever loop
3335 // instead; just scan the map ONCE for a task to do, and if it returns false
3336 // then stop scanning, abandon the activity, and kill the backlog of moves.
3337 if( !generic_multi_activity_handler( activity, *this->as_player(), true ) ) {
3338 revert_after_activity();
3339 set_moves( 0 );
3340 return true;
3341 }
3342 }
3343 // the multi-activity types can sometimes cancel the activity, and return without using up any moves.
3344 // ( when they are setting a destination etc. )
3345 // normally this isn't a problem, but in the main game loop, if the NPC has a huge backlog of moves;
3346 // then each of these occurrences will nudge the infinite loop counter up by one.
3347 // ( even if other move-using things occur inbetween )
3348 // so here - if no moves are used in a multi-type activity do_turn(), then subtract a nominal amount
3349 // to satisfy the infinite loop counter.
3350 const bool multi_type = activity ? activity.is_multi_type() : false;
3351 const int moves_before = moves;
3352 while( moves > 0 && activity ) {
3353 activity.do_turn( *this );
3354 if( !is_active() ) {
3355 return true;
3356 }
3357 }
3358 if( multi_type && moves == moves_before ) {
3359 moves -= 1;
3360 }
3361 /* if the activity is finished, grab any backlog or change the mission */
3362 if( !has_destination() && !activity ) {
3363 if( !backlog.empty() ) {
3364 activity = backlog.front();
3365 backlog.pop_front();
3366 current_activity_id = activity.id();
3367 } else {
3368 if( is_player_ally() ) {
3369 add_msg( m_info, string_format( "%s completed the assigned task.", disp_name() ) );
3370 }
3371 current_activity_id = activity_id::NULL_ID();
3372 revert_after_activity();
3373 // if we loaded after being out of the bubble for a while, we might have more
3374 // moves than we need, so clear them
3375 set_moves( 0 );
3376 }
3377 }
3378 return moves != old_moves;
3379}
3380
3381bool npc::wield_better_weapon()
3382{
3383 // TODO: Allow wielding weaker weapons against weaker targets
3384 bool can_use_gun = ( !is_player_ally() || rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_guns ) );
3385 bool use_silent = ( is_player_ally() && rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_silent ) );
3386 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3387
3388 // Check if there's something better to wield
3389 item *best = &weapon;
3390 double best_value = -100.0;
3391
3392 const int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS );
3393
3394 const auto compare_weapon =
3395 [this, &best, &best_value, ups_charges, can_use_gun, use_silent]( const item & it ) {
3396 bool allowed = can_use_gun && it.is_gun() && ( !use_silent || it.is_silent() );
3397 double val;
3398 if( !allowed ) {
3399 val = weapon_value( it, 0 );
3400 } else {
3401 int ammo_count = it.ammo_remaining();
3402 int ups_drain = it.get_gun_ups_drain();
3403 if( ups_drain > 0 ) {
3404 ammo_count = std::min( ammo_count, ups_charges / ups_drain );
3405 }
3406
3407 val = weapon_value( it, ammo_count );
3408 }
3409
3410 if( val > best_value ) {
3411 best = const_cast<item *>( &it );
3412 best_value = val;
3413 }
3414 };
3415
3416 compare_weapon( weapon );
3417 // To prevent changing to barely better stuff
3418 best_value *= std::max<float>( 1.0f, ai_cache.danger_assessment / 10.0f );
3419
3420 // Fists aren't checked below
3421 compare_weapon( null_item_reference() );
3422
3423 visit_items( [&compare_weapon, this]( item * node ) {
3424 // Only compare melee weapons, guns, or holstered items
3425 if( node->is_melee() || node->is_gun() ) {
3426 compare_weapon( *node );
3427 } else if( node->get_use( "holster" ) && !node->contents.empty() && node != &weapon ) {
3428 // TODO: special case for "wield from wielded holster"
3429 const item &holstered = node->get_contained();
3430 if( holstered.is_melee() || holstered.is_gun() ) {
3431 compare_weapon( holstered );
3432 }
3433 }
3434 return VisitResponse::SKIP;
3435 } );
3436
3437 // TODO: Reimplement switching to empty guns
3438 // Needs to check reload speed, RELOAD_ONE etc.
3439 // Until then, the NPCs should reload the guns as a last resort
3440
3441 if( best == &weapon ) {
3442 add_msg( m_debug, "Wielded %s is best at %.1f, not switching", best->type->get_id().str(),
3443 best_value );
3444 return false;
3445 }
3446
3447 add_msg( m_debug, "Wielding %s at value %.1f", best->type->get_id().str(), best_value );
3448
3449 wield( *best );
3450 return true;
3451}
3452
3453bool npc::scan_new_items()
3454{
3455 add_msg( m_debug, "%s scanning new items", name );
3456 if( wield_better_weapon() ) {
3457 return true;
3458 } else {
3459 // Stop "having new items" when you no longer do anything with them
3460 has_new_items = false;
3461 }
3462
3463 return false;
3464 // TODO: Armor?
3465}
3466
3467static void npc_throw( npc &np, item &it, int index, const tripoint &pos )
3468{
3469 if( get_player_character().sees( np ) ) {
3470 add_msg( _( "%1$s throws a %2$s." ), np.name, it.tname() );
3471 }
3472
3473 int stack_size = -1;
3474 if( it.count_by_charges() ) {
3475 stack_size = it.charges;
3476 it.charges = 1;
3477 }
3478 if( !np.is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations only pretend to throw
3479 np.throw_item( pos, it );
3480 }
3481 // Throw a single charge of a stacking object.
3482 if( stack_size == -1 || stack_size == 1 ) {
3483 np.i_rem( index );
3484 } else {
3485 it.charges = stack_size - 1;
3486 }
3487}
3488
3489bool npc::alt_attack()
3490{
3491 if( ( is_player_ally() && !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_grenades ) ) || is_hallucination() ) {
3492 return false;
3493 }
3494
3495 Creature *critter = current_target();
3496 if( critter == nullptr ) {
3497 // This function shouldn't be called...
3498 debugmsg( "npc::alt_attack() called with no target" );
3499 move_pause();
3500 return false;
3501 }
3502
3503 tripoint tar = critter->pos();
3504
3505 const int dist = rl_dist( pos(), tar );
3506 item *used = nullptr;
3507 // Remember if we have an item that is dangerous to hold
3508 bool used_dangerous = false;
3509
3510 static const std::string danger_string( "NPC_THROW_NOW" );
3511 static const std::string alt_string( "NPC_ALT_ATTACK" );
3512 // TODO: The active bomb with shortest fuse should be thrown first
3513 const auto check_alt_item = [&used, &used_dangerous, dist, this]( item & it ) {
3514 const bool dangerous = it.has_flag( danger_string );
3515 if( !dangerous && used_dangerous ) {
3516 return;
3517 }
3518
3519 // Not alt attack
3520 if( !dangerous && !it.has_flag( alt_string ) ) {
3521 return;
3522 }
3523
3524 // TODO: Non-thrown alt items
3525 if( !dangerous && throw_range( it ) < dist ) {
3526 return;
3527 }
3528
3529 // Low priority items
3530 if( !dangerous && used != nullptr ) {
3531 return;
3532 }
3533
3534 used = &it;
3535 used_dangerous = used_dangerous || dangerous;
3536 };
3537
3538 check_alt_item( weapon );
3539 for( auto &sl : inv.slice() ) {
3540 // TODO: Cached values - an itype slot maybe?
3541 check_alt_item( sl->front() );
3542 }
3543
3544 if( used == nullptr ) {
3545 return false;
3546 }
3547
3548 int weapon_index = get_item_position( used );
3549 if( weapon_index == INT_MIN ) {
3550 debugmsg( "npc::alt_attack() couldn't find expected item %s", used->tname() );
3551 return false;
3552 }
3553
3554 // Are we going to throw this item?
3555 if( !used->active && used->has_flag( "NPC_ACTIVATE" ) ) {
3556 activate_item( weapon_index );
3557 // Note: intentional lack of return here
3558 // We want to ignore player-centric rules to avoid carrying live explosives
3559 // TODO: Non-grenades
3560 }
3561
3562 // We are throwing it!
3563 int conf = confident_throw_range( *used, critter );
3564 const bool wont_hit = wont_hit_friend( tar, *used, true );
3565 if( dist <= conf && wont_hit ) {
3566 npc_throw( *this, *used, weapon_index, tar );
3567 return true;
3568 }
3569
3570 if( wont_hit ) {
3571 // Within this block, our chosen target is outside of our range
3572 update_path( tar );
3573 move_to_next(); // Move towards the target
3574 }
3575
3576 // Danger of friendly fire
3577 if( !wont_hit && !used_dangerous ) {
3578 // Safe to hold on to, for now
3579 // Maneuver around player
3580 avoid_friendly_fire();
3581 return true;
3582 }
3583
3584 map &here = get_map();
3585 // We need to throw this live (grenade, etc) NOW! Pick another target?
3586 for( int dist = 2; dist <= conf; dist++ ) {
3587 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), dist ) ) {
3588 const monster *const target_ptr = g->critter_at<monster>( pt );
3589 int newdist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
3590 // TODO: Change "newdist >= 2" to "newdist >= safe_distance(used)"
3591 if( newdist <= conf && newdist >= 2 && target_ptr &&
3592 wont_hit_friend( pt, *used, true ) ) {
3593 // Friendlyfire-safe!
3594 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( *target_ptr );
3595 if( !one_in( 100 ) ) {
3596 // Just to prevent infinite loops...
3597 if( alt_attack() ) {
3598 return true;
3599 }
3600 }
3601 return false;
3602 }
3603 }
3604 }
3605 /* If we have reached THIS point, there's no acceptable monster to throw our
3606 * grenade or whatever at. Since it's about to go off in our hands, better to
3607 * just chuck it as far away as possible--while being friendly-safe.
3608 */
3609 int best_dist = 0;
3610 for( int dist = 2; dist <= conf; dist++ ) {
3611 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), dist ) ) {
3612 int new_dist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
3613 if( new_dist > best_dist && wont_hit_friend( pt, *used, true ) ) {
3614 best_dist = new_dist;
3615 tar = pt;
3616 }
3617 }
3618 }
3619 /* Even if tar.x/tar.y didn't get set by the above loop, throw it anyway. They
3620 * should be equal to the original location of our target, and risking friendly
3621 * fire is better than holding on to a live grenade / whatever.
3622 */
3623 npc_throw( *this, *used, weapon_index, tar );
3624 return true;
3625}
3626
3627void npc::activate_item( int item_index )
3628{
3629 const int oldmoves = moves;
3630 item &it = i_at( item_index );
3631 if( it.is_tool() || it.is_food() ) {
3632 it.type->invoke( *this, it, pos() );
3633 }
3634
3635 if( moves == oldmoves ) {
3636 // HACK: A hack to prevent debugmsgs when NPCs activate 0 move items
3637 // while not removing the debugmsgs for other 0 move actions
3638 moves--;
3639 }
3640}

3642void npc::heal_player( player &patient )
3643{
3644 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), patient.pos() );
3645
3646 if( dist > 1 ) {
3647 // We need to move to the player
3648 update_path( patient.pos() );
3649 move_to_next();
3650 return;
3651 }
3652
3653 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3654 // Close enough to heal!
3655 bool u_see = player_character.sees( *this ) || player_character.sees( patient );
3656 if( u_see ) {
3657 add_msg( _( "%1$s heals %2$s." ), disp_name(), patient.disp_name() );
3658 }
3659
3660 item &used = get_healing_item( ai_cache.can_heal );
3661 if( used.is_null() ) {
3662 debugmsg( "%s tried to heal you but has no healing item", disp_name() );
3663 return;
3664 }
3665 if( !is_hallucination() ) {
3666 int charges_used = used.type->invoke( *this, used, patient.pos(), "heal" );
3667 consume_charges( used, charges_used );
3668 } else {
3669 pretend_heal( patient, used );
3670 }
3671
3672}
3673
3674void npc:: pretend_heal( player &patient, item used )
3675{
3676 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3677 add_msg( _( "%1$s heals %2$s." ), disp_name(),
3678 patient.disp_name() ); // you can tell that it's not real by looking at your HP though
3679 }
3680 consume_charges( used, 1 ); // empty hallucination's inventory to avoid spammming
3681 moves -= 100; // consumes moves to avoid infinite loop
3682}

3684void npc::heal_self()
3685{
3686 if( has_effect( effect_asthma ) ) {
3687 item &treatment = null_item_reference();
3688 std::string iusage = "OXYGEN_BOTTLE";
3689 if( has_charges( itype_inhaler, 1 ) ) {
3690 treatment = inv.find_item( inv.position_by_type( itype_inhaler ) );
3691 iusage = "INHALER";
3692 } else if( has_charges( itype_oxygen_tank, 1 ) ) {
3693 treatment = inv.find_item( inv.position_by_type( itype_oxygen_tank ) );
3694 } else if( has_charges( itype_smoxygen_tank, 1 ) ) {
3695 treatment = inv.find_item( inv.position_by_type( itype_smoxygen_tank ) );
3696 }
3697 if( !treatment.is_null() ) {
3698 treatment.type->invoke( *this, treatment, pos(), iusage );
3699 consume_charges( treatment, 1 );
3700 return;
3701 }
3702 }
3703
3704 item &used = get_healing_item( ai_cache.can_heal );
3705 if( used.is_null() ) {
3706 debugmsg( "%s tried to heal self but has no healing item", disp_name() );
3707 return;
3708 }
3709
3710 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3711 add_msg( _( "%s applies a %s" ), disp_name(), used.tname() );
3712 }
3713 warn_about( "heal_self", 1_turns );
3714
3715 int charges_used = used.type->invoke( *this, used, pos(), "heal" );
3716 if( used.is_medication() ) {
3717 consume_charges( used, charges_used );
3718 }

3720
3721void npc::use_painkiller()
3722{
3723 // First, find the best painkiller for our pain level
3724 item *it = inv.most_appropriate_painkiller( get_pain() );
3725
3726 if( it->is_null() ) {
3727 debugmsg( "NPC tried to use painkillers, but has none!" );
3728 move_pause();
3729 } else {
3730 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3731 add_msg( _( "%1$s takes some %2$s." ), disp_name(), it->tname() );
3732 }
3733 item_location loc = item_location( *this, it );
3734 consume( loc );
3735 moves = 0;
3736 }
3737}
3738
3739// We want our food to:
3740// Provide enough nutrition and quench
3741// Not provide too much of either (don't waste food)
3742// Not be unhealthy
3743// Not have side effects
3744// Be eaten before it rots (favor soon-to-rot perishables)
3745static float rate_food( const item &it, int want_nutr, int want_quench )
3746{
3747 const auto &food = it.get_comestible();
3748 if( !food ) {
3749 return 0.0f;
3750 }
3751
3752 if( food->parasites && !it.has_flag( "NO_PARASITES" ) ) {
3753 return 0.0;
3754 }
3755
3756 int nutr = food->get_default_nutr();
3757 int quench = food->quench;
3758
3759 if( nutr <= 0 && quench <= 0 ) {
3760 // Not food - may be salt, drugs etc.
3761 return 0.0f;
3762 }
3763
3764 if( !it.type->use_methods.empty() ) {
3765 // TODO: Get a good method of telling apart:
3766 // raw meat (parasites - don't eat unless mutant)
3767 // zed meat (poison - don't eat unless mutant)
3768 // alcohol (debuffs, health drop - supplement diet but don't bulk-consume)
3769 // caffeine (fine to consume, but expensive and prevents sleep)
3770 // hallucination mushrooms (NPCs don't hallucinate, so don't eat those)
3771 // honeycomb (harmless iuse)
3772 // royal jelly (way too expensive to eat as food)
3773 // mutagenic crap (don't eat, we want player to micromanage muties)
3774 // marloss (NPCs don't turn fungal)
3775 // weed brownies (small debuff)
3776 // seeds (too expensive)
3777
3778 // For now skip all of those
3779 return 0.0f;
3780 }
3781
3782 double relative_rot = it.get_relative_rot();
3783 if( relative_rot >= 1.0f ) {
3784 // TODO: Allow sapro mutants to eat it anyway and make them prefer it
3785 return 0.0f;
3786 }
3787
3788 float weight = std::max( 1.0, 10.0 * relative_rot );
3789 if( it.get_comestible_fun() < 0 ) {
3790 // This helps to avoid eating stuff like flour
3791 weight /= ( -it.get_comestible_fun() ) + 1;
3792 }
3793
3794 if( food->healthy < 0 ) {
3795 weight /= ( -food->healthy ) + 1;
3796 }
3797
3798 // Avoid wasting quench values unless it's about to rot away
3799 if( relative_rot < 0.9f && quench > want_quench ) {
3800 weight -= ( 1.0f - relative_rot ) * ( quench - want_quench );
3801 }
3802
3803 if( quench < 0 && want_quench > 0 && want_nutr < want_quench ) {
3804 // Avoid stuff that makes us thirsty when we're more thirsty than hungry
3805 weight = weight * want_nutr / want_quench;
3806 }
3807
3808 if( nutr > want_nutr ) {
3809 // TODO: Allow overeating in some cases
3810 if( nutr >= 5 ) {
3811 return 0.0f;
3812 }
3813
3814 if( relative_rot < 0.9f ) {
3815 weight /= nutr - want_nutr;
3816 }
3817 }
3818
3819 if( it.poison > 0 ) {
3820 weight -= it.poison;
3821 }
3822
3823 return weight;
3824}
3825
3826bool npc::consume_food_from_camp()
3827{
3828 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
3829 return false;
3830 }
3831 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3832 cata::optional<basecamp *> potential_bc;
3833 for( const tripoint_abs_omt &camp_pos : player_character.camps ) {
3834 if( rl_dist( camp_pos, global_omt_location() ) < 3 ) {
3835 potential_bc = overmap_buffer.find_camp( camp_pos.xy() );
3836 if( potential_bc ) {
3837 break;
3838 }
3839 }
3840 }
3841 if( !potential_bc ) {
3842 return false;
3843 }
3844 basecamp *bcp = *potential_bc;
3845 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::thirsty && bcp->has_water() ) {
3846 complain_about( "camp_water_thanks", 1_hours, "<camp_water_thanks>", false );
3847 set_thirst( 0 );
3848 return true;
3849 }
3850 faction *yours = player_character.get_faction();
3851 int camp_kcals = std::min( std::max( 0, 19 * max_stored_kcal() / 20 - get_stored_kcal() -
3852 stomach.get_calories() ), yours->food_supply );
3853 if( camp_kcals > 0 ) {
3854 complain_about( "camp_food_thanks", 1_hours, "<camp_food_thanks>", false );
3855 mod_stored_kcal( camp_kcals );
3856 yours->food_supply -= camp_kcals;
3857 return true;
3858 }
3859 complain_about( "camp_larder_empty", 1_hours, "<camp_larder_empty>", false );
3860 return false;
3861}
3862
3863bool npc::consume_food()
3864{
3865 float best_weight = 0.0f;
3866 int index = -1;
3867 int want_hunger = std::max<int>( 0, ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() ) / 10 );
3868 int want_quench = std::max( 0, get_thirst() );
3869 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3870 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
3871 const item &it = slice[i]->front();
3872 if( const item *food_item = it.get_food() ) {
3873 float cur_weight = rate_food( *food_item, want_hunger, want_quench );
3874 // Note: will_eat is expensive, avoid calling it if possible
3875 if( cur_weight > best_weight && will_eat( *food_item ).success() ) {
3876 best_weight = cur_weight;
3877 index = i;
3878 }
3879 }
3880 }
3881
3882 if( index == -1 ) {
3883 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
3884 // TODO: Remove this and let player "exploit" hungry NPCs
3885 set_stored_kcal( max_stored_kcal() );
3886 set_thirst( 0 );
3887 }
3888 return false;
3889 }
3890
3891 // consume doesn't return a meaningful answer, we need to compare moves
3892 // TODO: Make player::consume return false if it fails to consume
3893 int old_moves = moves;
3894 item_location loc = item_location( *this, &i_at( index ) );
3895 bool consumed = consume( loc ) && old_moves != moves;
3896 if( !consumed ) {
3897 debugmsg( "%s failed to consume %s", name, i_at( index ).tname() );
3898 }
3899
3900 return consumed;
3901}
3902
3903void npc::mug_player( Character &mark )
3904{
3905 if( mark.is_armed() ) {
3906 make_angry();
3907 }
3908
3909 if( rl_dist( pos(), mark.pos() ) > 1 ) { // We have to travel
3910 update_path( mark.pos() );
3911 move_to_next();
3912 return;
3913 }
3914
3915 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3916 const bool u_see = player_character.sees( *this ) || player_character.sees( mark );
3917 if( mark.cash > 0 ) {
3918 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations can't take items
3919 cash += mark.cash;
3920 mark.cash = 0;
3921 }
3922 moves = 0;
3923 // Describe the action
3924 if( mark.is_npc() ) {
3925 if( u_see ) {
3926 add_msg( _( "%1$s takes %2$s's money!" ), name, mark.name );
3927 }
3928 } else {
3929 add_msg( m_bad, _( "%s takes your money!" ), name );
3930 }
3931 return;
3932 }
3933
3934 // We already have their money; take some goodies!
3935 // value_mod affects at what point we "take the money and run"
3936 // A lower value means we'll take more stuff
3937 double value_mod = 1 - ( ( 10 - personality.bravery ) * .05 ) -
3938 ( ( 10 - personality.aggression ) * .04 ) -
3939 ( ( 10 - personality.collector ) * .06 );
3940 if( !mark.is_npc() ) {
3941 value_mod += ( op_of_u.fear * .08 );
3942 value_mod -= ( ( 8 - op_of_u.value ) * .07 );
3943 }
3944 double best_value = minimum_item_value() * value_mod;
3945 item *to_steal = nullptr;
3946 invslice slice = mark.inv.slice();
3947 for( std::list<item> *stack : slice ) {
3948 item &front_stack = stack->front();
3949 if( value( front_stack ) >= best_value &&
3950 can_pick_volume( front_stack ) &&
3951 can_pick_weight( front_stack, true ) ) {
3952 best_value = value( front_stack );
3953 to_steal = &front_stack;
3954 }
3955 }
3956 if( to_steal == nullptr ) { // Didn't find anything worthwhile!
3957 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP );
3958 if( !one_in( 3 ) ) {
3959 say( "<done_mugging>" );
3960 }
3961 moves -= 100;
3962 return;
3963 }
3964 item stolen;
3965 if( !is_hallucination() ) {
3966 stolen = mark.i_rem( to_steal );
3967 i_add( stolen );
3968 }
3969 if( mark.is_npc() ) {
3970 if( u_see ) {
3971 add_msg( _( "%1$s takes %2$s's %3$s." ), name, mark.name, stolen.tname() );
3972 }
3973 } else {
3974 add_msg( m_bad, _( "%1$s takes your %2$s." ), name, stolen.tname() );
3975 }
3976 moves -= 100;
3977 if( !mark.is_npc() ) {
3978 op_of_u.value -= rng( 0, 1 ); // Decrease the value of the player
3979 }
3980}

3984 complain_about( "look_for_player", 5_minutes, "<wait>", false );
3985 update_path( sought.pos() );
3986 move_to_next();
3987 return;

4031{

4033}
4034
4035void npc::reach_omt_destination()
4036{
4037 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4038 omt_path.clear();
4039 }
4040 map &here = get_map();
4041 if( is_travelling() ) {
4042 guard_pos = here.getabs( pos() );
4043 goal = no_goal_point;
4044 if( is_player_ally() ) {
4045 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
4046 talk_function::assign_guard( *this );
4047 if( rl_dist( player_character.pos(), pos() ) > SEEX * 2 || !player_character.sees( pos() ) ) {
4048 if( player_character.has_item_with_flag( "TWO_WAY_RADIO", true ) &&
4049 has_item_with_flag( "TWO_WAY_RADIO", true ) ) {
4050 add_msg( m_info, _( "From your two-way radio you hear %s reporting in, "
4051 "'I've arrived, boss!'" ), disp_name() );
4052 }
4053 }
4054 } else {
4055 // for now - they just travel to a nearby place they want as a base
4056 // and chill there indefinitely, the plan is to add systems for them to build
4057 // up their base, then go out on looting missions,
4058 // then return to base afterwards.
4059 set_mission( NPC_MISSION_GUARD );
4060 if( !needs.empty() && needs[0] == need_safety ) {
4061 // we found our base.
4062 base_location = global_omt_location();
4063 }
4064 }
4065 return;
4066 }
4067 // Guarding NPCs want a specific point, not just an overmap tile
4068 // Rest stops having a goal after reaching it
4069 if( !( is_guarding() || is_patrolling() ) ) {
4070 goal = no_goal_point;
4071 return;
4072 }
4073 // If we are guarding, remember our position in case we get forcibly moved
4074 goal = global_omt_location();
4075 if( guard_pos == here.getabs( pos() ) ) {
4076 // This is the specific point
4077 return;
4078 }
4079
4080 if( path.size() > 1 ) {
4081 // No point recalculating the path to get home
4082 move_to_next();
4083 } else if( guard_pos != tripoint_min ) {
4084 update_path( here.getlocal( guard_pos ) );
4085 move_to_next();
4086 } else {
4087 guard_pos = here.getabs( pos() );
4088 }
4089}
4090
4091void npc::set_omt_destination()
4092{
4093 /* TODO: Make NPCs' movement more intelligent.
4094 * Right now this function just makes them attempt to address their needs:
4095 * if we need ammo, go to a gun store, if we need food, go to a grocery store,
4096 * and if we don't have any needs, pick a random spot.
4097 * What it SHOULD do is that, if there's time; but also look at our mission and
4098 * our faction to determine more meaningful actions, such as attacking a rival
4099 * faction's base, or meeting up with someone friendly. NPCs should also
4100 * attempt to reach safety before nightfall, and possibly similar goals.
4101 * Also, NPCs should be able to assign themselves missions like "break into that
4102 * lab" or "map that river bank."
4103 */
4104 if( is_stationary( true ) ) {
4105 guard_current_pos();
4106 return;
4107 }
4108
4109 // all of the following luxuries are at ground level.
4110 // so please wallow in hunger & fear if below ground.
4111 if( posz() != 0 && !get_map().has_zlevels() ) {
4112 goal = no_goal_point;
4113 return;
4114 }
4115
4116 tripoint_abs_omt surface_omt_loc = global_omt_location();
4117 // We need that, otherwise find_closest won't work properly
4118 surface_omt_loc.z() = 0;
4119
4120 // also, don't bother looking if the CITY_SIZE is 0, just go somewhere at random
4121 const int city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
4122 if( city_size == 0 ) {
4123 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4124 return;
4125 }
4126
4127 decide_needs();
4128 if( needs.empty() ) { // We don't need anything in particular.
4129 needs.push_back( need_none );
4130 }
4131
4132 std::string dest_type;
4133 for( const auto &fulfill : needs ) {
4134 // look for the closest occurence of any of that locations terrain types
4135 std::vector<oter_type_id> loc_list = get_location_for( fulfill )->get_all_terrains();
4136 std::shuffle( loc_list.begin(), loc_list.end(), rng_get_engine() );
4137 omt_find_params find_params;
4138 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type>> temp_types;
4139 for( const oter_type_id &elem : loc_list ) {
4140 std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type> temp_pair;
4141 temp_pair.first = elem.id().str();
4142 temp_pair.second = ot_match_type::type;
4143 temp_types.push_back( temp_pair );
4144 }
4145 find_params.search_range = 75;
4146 find_params.min_distance = 0;
4147 find_params.must_see = false;
4148 find_params.cant_see = false;
4149 find_params.types = temp_types;
4150 find_params.existing_only = false;
4151 goal = overmap_buffer.find_closest( surface_omt_loc, find_params );
4152 omt_path.clear();
4153 if( goal != overmap::invalid_tripoint ) {
4154 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4155 }
4156 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4157 break;
4158 }
4159 }
4160
4161 // couldn't find any places to go, so go somewhere.
4162 if( goal == overmap::invalid_tripoint || omt_path.empty() ) {
4163 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4164 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4165 // try one more time
4166 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
4167 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4168 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4169 }
4170 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
4171 goal = no_goal_point;
4172 }
4173 return;
4174 }
4175
4176 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "npc::set_omt_destination - new goal for NPC [" << get_name()
4177 << "] with [" << get_need_str_id( needs.front() )
4178 << "] is [" << dest_type << "] in " << goal.to_string() << ".";
4179}
4180
4181void npc::go_to_omt_destination()
4182{
4183 map &here = get_map();
4184 if( ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
4185 if( here.getabs( pos() ) == *ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
4186 path.clear();
4187 ai_cache.guard_pos = cata::nullopt;
4188 move_pause();
4189 return;
4190 }
4191 }
4192 if( goal == no_goal_point || omt_path.empty() ) {
4193 add_msg( m_debug, "npc::go_to_destination with no goal" );
4194 move_pause();
4195 reach_omt_destination();
4196 return;
4197 }
4198 const tripoint_abs_omt omt_pos = global_omt_location();
4199 if( goal == omt_pos ) {
4200 // We're at our desired map square! Pause to keep the NPC infinite loop counter happy
4201 move_pause();
4202 reach_omt_destination();
4203 return;
4204 }
4205 if( !path.empty() ) {
4206 // we already have a path, just use that until we can't.
4207 move_to_next();
4208 return;
4209 }
4210 // get the next path point
4211 if( omt_path.back() == omt_pos ) {
4212 // this should be the square we are at.
4213 omt_path.pop_back();
4214 }
4215 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4216 point_rel_omt omt_diff = omt_path.back().xy() - omt_pos.xy();
4217 if( omt_diff.x() > 3 || omt_diff.x() < -3 || omt_diff.y() > 3 || omt_diff.y() < -3 ) {
4218 // we've gone wandering somehow, reset destination.
4219 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
4220 set_omt_destination();
4221 } else {
4222 talk_function::assign_guard( *this );
4223 }
4224 return;
4225 }
4226 }
4227 // TODO: fix point types
4228 tripoint sm_tri =
4229 here.getlocal( project_to<coords::ms>( omt_path.back() ).raw() );
4230 tripoint centre_sub = sm_tri + point( SEEX, SEEY );
4231 if( !here.passable( centre_sub ) ) {
4232 auto candidates = here.points_in_radius( centre_sub, 2 );
4233 for( const auto &elem : candidates ) {
4234 if( here.passable( elem ) ) {
4235 centre_sub = elem;
4236 break;
4237 }
4238 }
4239 }
4240 path = here.route( pos(), centre_sub, get_pathfinding_settings(), get_path_avoid() );
4241 add_msg( m_debug, "%s going %s->%s", name, omt_pos.to_string(), goal.to_string() );
4242
4243 if( !path.empty() ) {
4244 move_to_next();
4245 return;
4246 }
4247 move_pause();
4248}
4249
4250void npc::guard_current_pos()
4251{
4252 goal = global_omt_location();
4253 guard_pos = get_map().getabs( pos() );
4254}

4349// Maybe TODO: Move to Character method and use map methods
4350static body_part bp_affected( npc &who, const efftype_id &effect_type )
4351{
4352 body_part ret = num_bp;
4353 int highest_intensity = INT_MIN;
4354 for( const body_part bp : all_body_parts ) {
4355 const auto &eff = who.get_effect( effect_type, bp );
4356 if( !eff.is_null() && eff.get_intensity() > highest_intensity ) {
4357 ret = bp;
4358 highest_intensity = eff.get_intensity();
4359 }
4360 }
4361
4362 return ret;
4363}

4365static std::string distance_string( int range )
4366{
4367 if( range < 6 ) {
4368 return "<danger_close_distance>";
4369 } else if( range < 11 ) {
4370 return "<close_distance>";
4371 } else if( range < 26 ) {
4372 return "<medium_distance>";
4373 } else {
4374 return "<far_distance>";
4375 }
4376}
4377
4378void npc::warn_about( const std::string &type, const time_duration &d, const std::string &name,
4379 int range, const tripoint &danger_pos )
4380{
4381 std::string snip;
4382 sounds::sound_t spriority = sounds::sound_t::alert;
4383 if( type == "monster" ) {
4384 snip = is_enemy() ? "<monster_warning_h>" : "<monster_warning>";
4385 } else if( type == "explosion" ) {
4386 snip = is_enemy() ? "<fire_in_the_hole_h>" : "<fire_in_the_hole>";
4387 } else if( type == "general_danger" ) {
4388 snip = is_enemy() ? "<general_danger_h>" : "<general_danger>";
4389 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4390 } else if( type == "relax" ) {
4391 snip = is_enemy() ? "<its_safe_h>" : "<its_safe>";
4392 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4393 } else if( type == "kill_npc" ) {
4394 snip = is_enemy() ? "<kill_npc_h>" : "<kill_npc>";
4395 } else if( type == "kill_player" ) {
4396 snip = is_enemy() ? "<kill_player_h>" : "";
4397 } else if( type == "run_away" ) {
4398 snip = "<run_away>";
4399 } else if( type == "cant_flee" ) {
4400 snip = "<cant_flee>";
4401 } else if( type == "fire_bad" ) {
4402 snip = "<fire_bad>";
4403 } else if( type == "speech_noise" ) {
4404 snip = "<speech_warning>";
4405 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4406 } else if( type == "combat_noise" ) {
4407 snip = "<combat_noise_warning>";
4408 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4409 } else if( type == "movement_noise" ) {
4410 snip = "<movement_noise_warning>";
4411 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4412 } else if( type == "heal_self" ) {
4413 snip = "<heal_self>";
4414 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4415 } else {
4416 return;
4417 }
4418 const std::string warning_name = "warning_" + type + name;
4419 if( name.empty() ) {
4420 complain_about( warning_name, d, snip, is_enemy(), spriority );
4421 } else {
4422 const std::string range_str = range < 1 ? "<punc>" :
4423 string_format( _( " %s, %s" ),
4424 direction_name( direction_from( pos(), danger_pos ) ),
4425 distance_string( range ) );
4426 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "%s %s%s" ), snip, name, range_str );
4427 complain_about( warning_name, d, speech, is_enemy(), spriority );
4428 }
4429}
4430
4431bool npc::complain_about( const std::string &issue, const time_duration &dur,
4432 const std::string &speech, const bool force, const sounds::sound_t priority )
4433{
4434 // Don't have a default constructor for time_point, so accessing it in the
4435 // complaints map is a bit difficult, those lambdas should cover it.
4436 const auto complain_since = [this]( const std::string & key, const time_duration & d ) {
4437 const auto iter = complaints.find( key );
4438 return iter == complaints.end() || iter->second < calendar::turn - d;
4439 };
4440 const auto set_complain_since = [this]( const std::string & key ) {
4441 const auto iter = complaints.find( key );
4442 if( iter == complaints.end() ) {
4443 complaints.emplace( key, calendar::turn );
4444 } else {
4445 iter->second = calendar::turn;
4446 }
4447 };
4448
4449 // Don't wake player up with non-serious complaints
4450 // Stop complaining while asleep
4451 const bool do_complain = force || ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_complain ) &&
4452 !get_player_character().in_sleep_state() && !in_sleep_state() );
4453
4454 if( complain_since( issue, dur ) && do_complain ) {
4455 say( speech, priority );
4456 set_complain_since( issue );
4457 return true;
4458 }
4459 return false;
4460}
4461
4462bool npc::complain()
4463{
4464 static const std::string infected_string = "infected";
4465 static const std::string fatigue_string = "fatigue";
4466 static const std::string bite_string = "bite";
4467 static const std::string bleed_string = "bleed";
4468 static const std::string radiation_string = "radiation";
4469 static const std::string hunger_string = "hunger";
4470 static const std::string thirst_string = "thirst";
4471
4472 if( !is_player_ally() || !get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
4473 return false;
4474 }
4475
4476 // When infected, complain every (4-intensity) hours
4477 // At intensity 3, ignore player wanting us to shut up
4478 if( has_effect( effect_infected ) ) {
4479 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_infected );
4480 const auto &eff = get_effect( effect_infected, bp );
4481 int intensity = eff.get_intensity();
4482 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "My %s wound is infected…" ),
4483 body_part_name( bp ) );
4484 if( complain_about( infected_string, time_duration::from_hours( 4 - intensity ), speech,
4485 intensity >= 3 ) ) {
4486 // Only one complaint per turn
4487 return true;
4488 }
4489 }
4490
4491 // When bitten, complain every hour, but respect restrictions
4492 if( has_effect( effect_bite ) ) {
4493 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_bite );
4494 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "The bite wound on my %s looks bad." ),
4495 body_part_name( bp ) );
4496 if( complain_about( bite_string, 1_hours, speech ) ) {
4497 return true;
4498 }
4499 }
4500
4501 // When tired, complain every 30 minutes
4502 // If massively tired, ignore restrictions
4503 if( get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::tired &&
4504 complain_about( fatigue_string, 30_minutes, _( "<yawn>" ),
4505 get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::massive - 100 ) ) {
4506 return true;
4507 }
4508
4509 // Radiation every 10 minutes
4510 if( get_rad() > 90 ) {
4511 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_radscrubber );
4512 std::string speech = _( "I'm suffering from radiation sickness…" );
4513 if( complain_about( radiation_string, 10_minutes, speech, get_rad() > 150 ) ) {
4514 return true;
4515 }
4516 } else if( !get_rad() ) {
4517 deactivate_bionic_by_id( bio_radscrubber );
4518 }
4519
4520 // Hunger every 3-6 hours
4521 // Since NPCs can't starve to death, respect the rules
4522 if( get_kcal_percent() < 0.9 &&
4523 complain_about( hunger_string, std::max( 3_hours,
4524 time_duration::from_minutes( get_kcal_percent() * 60 * 7 ) ), _( "<hungry>" ) ) ) {
4525 return true;
4526 }
4527
4528 // Thirst every 2 hours
4529 // Since NPCs can't dry to death, respect the rules
4530 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::very_thirsty &&
4531 complain_about( thirst_string, 2_hours, _( "<thirsty>" ) ) ) {
4532 return true;
4533 }
4534
4535 //Bleeding every 5 minutes
4536 if( has_effect( effect_bleed ) ) {
4537 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_bleed );
4538 std::string speech = string_format( _( "My %s is bleeding!" ), body_part_name( bp ) );
4539 if( complain_about( bleed_string, 5_minutes, speech ) ) {
4540 return true;
4541 }
4542 }
4543
4544 return false;
4545}
4546
4547void npc::do_reload( const item &it )
4548{
4549 item::reload_option reload_opt = select_ammo( it );
4550
4551 if( !reload_opt ) {
4552 debugmsg( "do_reload failed: no usable ammo for %s", it.tname() );
4553 return;
4554 }
4555
4556 // Note: we may be reloading the magazine inside, not the gun itself
4557 // Maybe TODO: allow reload functions to understand such reloads instead of const casts
4558 item &target = const_cast<item &>( *reload_opt.target );
4559 item_location &usable_ammo = reload_opt.ammo;
4560
4561 int qty = std::max( 1, std::min( usable_ammo->charges,
4562 it.ammo_capacity() - it.ammo_remaining() ) );
4563 int reload_time = item_reload_cost( it, *usable_ammo, qty );
4564 // TODO: Consider printing this info to player too
4565 const std::string ammo_name = usable_ammo->tname();
4566 if( !target.reload( *this, std::move( usable_ammo ), qty ) ) {
4567 debugmsg( "do_reload failed: item %s could not be reloaded with %ld charge(s) of %s",
4568 it.tname(), qty, ammo_name );
4569 return;
4570 }
4571
4572 moves -= reload_time;
4573 recoil = MAX_RECOIL;
4574
4575 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
4576 add_msg( _( "%1$s reloads their %2$s." ), name, it.tname() );
4577 sfx::play_variant_sound( "reload", it.typeId().str(), sfx::get_heard_volume( pos() ),
4578 sfx::get_heard_angle( pos() ) );
4579 }
4580
4581 // Otherwise the NPC may not equip the weapon until they see danger
4582 has_new_items = true;
4583}
4584
4585bool npc::adjust_worn()
4586{
4587 bool any_broken = false;
4588 for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts() ) {
4589 if( is_limb_broken( bp ) ) {
4590 any_broken = true;
4591 break;
4592 }
4593 }
4594
4595 if( !any_broken ) {
4596 return false;
4597 }
4598 const auto covers_broken = [this]( const item & it, side s ) {
4599 const body_part_set covered = it.get_covered_body_parts( s );
4600 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
4601 if( elem.second.get_hp_cur() <= 0 && covered.test( elem.first->token ) ) {
4602 return true;
4603 }
4604 }
4605 return false;
4606 };
4607
4608 for( auto &elem : worn ) {
4609 if( !elem.has_flag( "SPLINT" ) ) {
4610 continue;
4611 }
4612
4613 if( !covers_broken( elem, elem.get_side() ) ) {
4614 const bool needs_change = covers_broken( elem, opposite_side( elem.get_side() ) );
4615 // Try to change side (if it makes sense), or take off.
4616 if( ( needs_change && change_side( elem ) ) || takeoff( elem ) ) {
4617 return true;
4618 }
4619 }
4620 }
4621
4622 return false;
4623}
